page.title: DeadAir Script T Files
page.t: Allows the player to use credits or favors to increase relations between two factions.
Allows the player to use credits or favors to increase relations between two factions. Decreasing relation between two factions requires a certain level of trust (reputation) with the faction.
Shows recent events similar to logbook.
Shows the amount of military ships that each supported faction has.
Shows the amount of economic ships and stations that each supported faction has.
Shows a general overview of a faction's amount of wares stored compared to amount desired.
Shows a general overview of a faction's station storage split between stations that produce a ware and stations that consume a ware.
Collection of options available to change how the Dynamic War script runs.
Allows the player to unlock a factions relation. This may cause issues with certain storyline missions.
Allows the player to enable or disable certain factions from Dynamic War script. Disabling a faction may help avoid issues with certain storyline missions.
You do not have enough reputation with (FACTION)
Changes whether the Dynamic War script will continue to run. Disabling does not revert relations.
Changes whether the player will continue to accrue favors for maintaining 20+ relation with a faction.
Changes the time \(in minutes\) between Dynamic War events. Default = 30 minutes
Changes the weighting of events where two factions' relation will increase TO 25. To calculate percent chance, take this weight and divide by total weight of events. Default = 1
Changes the weighting of events where two factions' relation will increase BY 15. To calculate percent chance, take this weight and divide by total weight of events. Default = 16
Changes the weighting of events where two factions' relation will increase BY 5. To calculate percent chance, take this weight and divide by total weight of events. Default = 32
Changes the weighting of events where two factions' relation will decrease BY 5. To calculate percent chance, take this weight and divide by total weight of events. Default = 32
Changes the weighting of events where two factions' relation will decrease BY 15. To calculate percent chance, take this weight and divide by total weight of events. Default = 16
Changes the weighting of events where two factions' relation will decrease TO -30. To calculate percent chance, take this weight and divide by total weight of events. Default = 1
Changes the weighting of events where two factions' relation will NOT change. To calculate percent chance, take this weight and divide by total weight of events. Default = 0
Changes the effect that a factions primary race plays. Factions will tend to be more friendly with same race and xenophobic the higher this value is. This value is multiplicative. Default = 0.25

Changes the effect that a factions current relation plays. Factions will tend to continue friendly relations or continue hostility the higher this value is. This value is multiplicative. Default = 0.5
Changes the effect that a factions current allies and enemies plays. Factions will tend to form coalitions the higher this value is. This value is multiplicative. Default = 0.25
TODO. Changes whether logbook entries have added flavor text. Does not affect gameplay but takes a lot of work to write them.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.
This faction is able to be selected in the Dynamic War script. Only factions that are active, claim space, and have unlocked relations will be chosen.
This faction will not be selected by the Dynamic War script.

Changes whether a script that limits and corrects faction relations will run. This script prevents AI to AI relations above 27 to avoid meeting the "Self" condition. It also corrects {20203,701} relations to match {20203,601} to avoid civil war.

The number of factions the script will have as potential second faction during an event. Increasing this value can potentially cause an impact to performance as there is a large amount of calculations for determining faction strength. Default = 4
Changes whether the Evolution script will continue to run. Disabling does not revert ships already upgraded.
Changes the time \(in minutes\) between evolution level increases. Has no effect if Evolution disabled or already at max level. Default = 120 minutes
Shows the current progress level of Evolution.
Changes whether additional ships are built by xenon.
Changes the maximum number of Xenon fleets that will be ordered built by Xenon from this mod. Default = 10 fleets
Size of the Xenon fleets added by Evolution. This will only affect future fleets built. Default = Medium
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.

Changes whether Xenon shipyards will expand at evolution levels 1,3, and 5. At each of these tiers they will add two additional storage modules, an additional XL ship builder, and an additional defense module.

Changes whether Xenon will order one or multiple Evolution fleets at a time. If enabled, Xenon will order one fleet at each shipyard. If disabled, Xenon will order one fleet at one shipyard. Fleets ordered will respect Maximum Xenon Fleets Added amount.
Changes whether the Fill script will continue to run.
How often Fill will check stations. Default=60
The lowest percentage of capacity a ware can be before removing cargo at the {20102,1051}. Set to 100 to disable the removal of cargo. Default=90.
The percentage capacity a ware will be after removing cargo at the {20102,1051}. Default=75.
The highest percentage of capacity a ware can be before adding cargo at the {20102,1051}. Set to 0 to disable the adding of cargo. Default=5.
The percentage capacity a ware will be after adding cargo at the {20102,1051}. Default=10.
The highest percentage capacity a ware can be before adding cargo at the {20102,1071}/{20102,1081}. Set to 0 to disable the adding of cargo. Default=5.
The percentage capacity a ware will be after adding cargo at the {20102,1071}/{20102,1081}. Default=10.
Changes whether the Fill script will add ship mods to a random XL/L ship of the station owner when resources are drained.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.
Changes whether the added expeditions jobs for factions will continue to be built, organized, and launched to attack enemies.
Changes whether the custom logic for determining Critical, Core, Border, and Contested sector jobs will continue to be built, organized, and launched to reinforce sectors.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode. These debugs are extremely detailed and extensive.
This job patrols sectors that are considered critical to a faction. The sectors must include a shipyard or wharf AND be owned by the faction.

This job patrols sectors that are considered to be the core sectors. The sectors must not border enemy sectors or be contested. Sector must be owned by the faction and typically contains economic stations not expected to be under considerable threat.
This job patrols sectors that border enemy or unfriendly sectors. The sectors must be owned by the faction and are expected to be under considerable threat.

This job patrols sectors that have enemy or unfriendly presence in the sector. The sector must include at least one station owned by this faction and an enemy faction. These sectors are considered under considerable threat and the faction will attempt to increase it's control.
This number is the number of fleets the faction will attempt to maintain across the entire galaxy. If this number is set to 0 it will disable future orders of these fleets.
This number is the maximum number of fleets the faction will attempt to maintain in each sector that meets the criteria. If this number is set to 0 it will disable future orders of these fleets.
This job trades an assorted collection of container goods using a large sized ship.
This job trades an assorted collection of container goods using a medium sized ship.
This job mines assorted minerals using a large sized ship.
This job mines assorted minerals using a medium sized ship.
This job mines assorted gasses using a large sized ship.
This job mines assorted gasses using a medium sized ship.
Changes whether the Dynamic News script will continue to run.
Changes whether Dynamic News will send notifications on monitored events.
Changes whether Dynamic News will write to the logbook on monitored events.
Changes whether Dynamic News will store recent news events.
Changes the minimum time between the script checking for any new reports. This will change the time between checks for groups of reports that will be output in regular intervals.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.
%1 extending station %2 \(%3\) with additional %4 modules in %5.
Changes whether the DA Gate script will continue to run. This only affects the scripts that find the gates, it does not revert gate status.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.
Changes whether the DA God options are available in the menu. This does not run the script or change anything in the game on it's own.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.
Changes whether the amount of modules set in the options for this faction will apply when the script is triggered.
The ware produced by the station ordered by the DA God script.

The number of modules that will be built by the DA God script. Stations will each have up to 20 modules each when requested. Each ware and increment of 20 would result in an additional station so be aware that this may affect performance. The default values are from the old DA God and will result in a strong and balanced economy.
This will trigger the script to run for this faction when this button is clicked. It will use the numbers set above on the sliders and is not reversible.
The script for this faction has already been activated. Multiple runs for the same faction is not yet supported.
